newsitem.title: POLAND: POLAND SACKS FOREIGN TRADE MINISTER BUCHACZ.
newsitem.headline: POLAND SACKS FOREIGN TRADE MINISTER BUCHACZ.

text.p: Poland's president sacked Foreign Trade Minister Jacek Buchacz on Wednesday after inspections revealed a problem over the granting of export guarantees, the government information office said in a statement.
It said Buchacz was fired by President Aleksander Kwasniewski on a motion by Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz.
"The motion of the head of cabinet in this matter is linked with a need to guarantee better care over the interests of the state treasury," the statement said.
Buchacz is a member of the Polish Peasant Party (PSL) smaller partner in a tense two-party ruling coalition with the ex-communist Democratic Left Alliance (SLD), to which Cimoszewicz belongs.
Heads of the two parties gathered for a crisis meeting after the announcement at a Warsaw government building, but PAP news agency said the Peasant delegation quickly left the meeting.

The statement said the sacking of Buchacz was closely related to results of inspections by the Supreme Auditing Chamber (NIK) and the Cabinet Supervision Office -- two powerful official oversight bodies.
It said the probes concerned "the involvement of the treasury in ventures concerning export guarantees, in which state and private property is connected in a way that lacks sufficient clarity."
The PSL and the SLD have recently clashed over the distribution of cabinet posts during a reorganisation of central government due this year, but had appeared to settle their differences.
An official source, who asked not to be named, told Reuters that Cimoszewicz had surprised the Peasant party with the motion to oust Buchacz.
The move looked set to place new strains on the coalition -- which has been trying to stay together at least until parliamentary elections due in September next year.
Buchacz has been foreign trade minister for since early 1995. He was appointed by the previous Prime Minister Jozef Oleksy and inherited the portfolio in the current cabinet.
